lexUnit.name: revenge.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: retaliation for an injury or wrong.

sentence.text: I thought it probable the police were right , he had sought revenge against Imogen Surkov for separating him from his nice third wife , Vera , and their son .
An estimated 50,000 Shias attended Musawi 's funeral on Feb. 17 in the southern outskirts of Beirut , vowing revenge against Israel .
The plunge was partly the revenge of a group of investors invited to sample the Disney rides in a pre-opening visit on Tuesday .

She claimed that , ` in a culture whose already classical dilemma is the hypertrophy of the intellect at the expense of energy and sensual capability , interpretation is the revenge of the intellect upon art " .
Peru fears revenge of Blackburn vampire
This appearance of na√Øvety was a mask ; it was his revenge on lesser people than himself .
What we did n't know for a long time was that this book is his revenge on his parents .
Edward 's extravagant revenge on his erstwhile enemies -- the so-called Contrariants -- was hardly calculated to reconcile them and was too excessive to repress them .
That was my revenge on you , for causing me so much trouble ! " she cried angrily .
However , he played down speculation that the Government would seek revenge for alleged anti-Tory bias in BBC coverage of the election .
The ban is Prince Charles 's revenge for her refusal to spend Christmas with the rest of the royals at Sandringham in Norfolk .
However , Bernard had filled the bottles with supermarket plonk , considering this adequate revenge for having been told by the same neighbour that his new perfume was ` rather bourgeois " .
He permitted himself a few seconds to savour his revenge , before delivering the coup de grace with a heti'i power-kick , which would snap Grant 's neck like a dried stick .
He lay on the bed , kicking the wall , sniffed a bit , swore terrible revenge on Sylvester who , he was convinced , had put all this into action , and eventually pulled the blanket over him .
To extract confessions or exact revenge , the police may use beatings , electric shocks , crushing with heavy rollers , burning and sexual mutilation against their prisoners .
When de Raimes had exacted his revenge he would hand her over to his knight , who would complete her destruction .
I was satisfied that the Luciferi had killed her and I was determined , in my own cowardly way , to exact revenge once I was in France .
This showed a lot of foresight , but unfortunately for Eddie Carbone , Marco did exact revenge on him -- arguably in self defence however .
It was a great way to get revenge for various slights , lost jobs , bad reviews or even undeserved success .
John Sandiford was trying to get revenge by making the QC -- now a judge -- late for a case .
A short while later Joseph had his revenge on Watney 's .
I wo n't stay here to have my contemptible revenge on Jack , to see his surprise when I drop the mask .
Two years later James had his revenge when he had the earl beheaded .
The statement claimed that the bombing was in revenge for the assassination of Musawi .
The Ulster Freedom Fighters said the offensive would be in revenge for IRA attacks on Protestant communities .
Bitterly resigned to the betrothal , she took a fiendish revenge .
Many of my hon. Friends will take revenge on me for making that remark , because the Whips hijack hon. Members into taking part in , and thereby lengthening , long and tedious debates .
He had driven home from the cinema at a furious pace -- tyres squealing , overtaking in the inside lane -- determined to wreak his revenge on the girl who had rejected him .
He was the only one to know that today was the day when Hasan was going to wreak his revenge .
I thought at the beginning that you were working with him , that it was your revenge for Eddie 's death .
